Content.Text:
<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'll show you around the town tomorrow.
For today, let's go and look at your new
farm. This way.

<FACE_HOSSAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Everyone here has been so good to us,
but there's no point in an inn with no
one coming to stay.

<FACE_HOSSAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
We're going to try running an inn in
another town.
<PAGE>
I don't know if it will work out, but
we're going to give it a try.
Right, <BLUE>Niko</BLUE>?

<FACE_HANA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<NAME_UNKOWN>I understand... But do say you'll
eventually come back, okay? We'll be
waiting for you!

<FACE_HOSSAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ROUGH>
This is our hometown. We'll be back.
<PAGE>
We may even make it big in another town
and come back rich!

<FACE_HANA><POS_LEFT><FACE_ROUGH>
<NAME_UNKOWN>Yes, you may indeed! I hope you'll
remember us when that happens!

<FACE_HOSSAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ROUGH>
Hah hah hah, of course. It's time for us
to be going, anyway.

<FACE_EMA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
<NAME_UNKOWN>We'll see you to the exit from town. As
this is goodbye for... for a while.

<FACE_HOSSAN><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thank you so much. Shall we, ladies?

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, sorry about that. I didn't mean to
stop for so long.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Those were some of our residents. The
lady in the straw hat is <BLUE>Hana</BLUE>, and the
one in the white apron is <BLUE>Emma</BLUE>. 
<PAGE>
The father and son standing by the cart
are going to be leaving town today.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
As you might have figured out by now, we
don't have many people living here.
You can count them on one hand...

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
This town is not without its appeal!
It's overflowing with nature and the
people are kind and honest.
<PAGE>
But that alone isn't enough to operate
as a successful town.
<PAGE>
The falling number of people means
there's no work, and that drives more
people away. A vicious circle.

<FACE_DUNHILL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Sorry for hitting you with all this
right after you got here.
<PAGE>
I just don't want to misrepresent what's
going on here in town.
<PAGE>
Let's put troubling talk aside for now
and go see the farm. Come on!
